```{r, include = FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(
  collapse = TRUE,
  comment = "#>"
)
```

```{r setup}
library(apa7)
library(dplyr)
d <- mtcars %>% 
  select(Gears = gear, Transmission = am) %>% 
  mutate(Transmission = factor(Transmission, labels = c("Automatic", "Manual")))
  
```

The default output of the `apa_chisq` function is a contingency table with a chi-square test of independence in the table note. The output is a flextable, which can be modified in any way one perfers.

```{r}
apa_chisq(d)
```

The table can be styled in many ways:

```{r}
apa_chisq(d, font_size = 16, line_spacing = 3, text_color = "darkred", border_width = 2, border_color = "gray", family = "Arial")
```
